item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Adding iodine to salt played a role in cognitive improvements: research (2013) (120 points | 63 comments)
2. An analysis of DeepSeek's R1-Zero and R1 (171 points | 79 comments)
3. A minimal PyTorch implementation for training your own small LLM from scratch (52 points | 7 comments)
4. Ötzi the Lyme Mummy (2019) (46 points | 10 comments)
5. OpenAI says it has evidence DeepSeek used its model to train competitor (177 points | 822 comments)
6. I still like Sublime Text (861 points | 464 comments)
7. Bacteria (and Their Metabolites) and Depression (342 points | 141 comments)
8. Society for Technical Communication to permanently close its doors (53 points | 11 comments)
9. Case Study: ByteDance Uses eBPF to Enhance Networking Performance (52 points | 4 comments)
10. DeepSeek's Hidden Bias: How We Cut It by 76% Without Performance Loss (67 points | 40 comments)
11. Intel doesn't know how to be a foundry," Tim Cook reportedly told TSMC's CEO (98 points | 57 comments)
12. Frigade (YC W23) is hiring engineer #2 ( | hide)
13. Waymo to test its autonomous driving technology in over 10 new cities (25 points | 10 comments)
14. Building a T1D smartwatch for my son from scratch (4 points | discuss)
15. Astral – "We're building a new static type checker for Python" (103 points | 29 comments)

17. Google Pixel 4a's old firmware is gone, trapping users on buggy battery update (182 points | 144 comments)
18. Integration of 1,024 silicon quantum dots with on-chip electronics (6 points | discuss)
19. Seagate: 'new' hard drives used for tens of thousands of hours (253 points | 154 comments)
20. Preserves: An Expressive Data Language (60 points | 23 comments)
21. No Man's Sky's update introduces billions of new stars, planets, and more (86 points | 59 comments)
22. Why DeepSeek had to be open source (461 points | 230 comments)
23. Boom XB-1 First Supersonic Flight [video] (674 points | 487 comments)
24. Sweden eyes sending inmates abroad as prisons full due to gang crime wave (25 points | 4 comments)
25. Adding concurrent read/write to DuckDB with Arrow Flight (62 points | 18 comments)
26. Ask HN: Are there "story-based" and "fact-based" people? (12 points | 2 comments)
27. Complete hardware and software setup for running Deepseek-R1 locally (198 points | 147 comments)
28. Effective AI code suggestions: less is more (21 points | 6 comments)
29. The ancient discovery that put a Silk Road city back on the map (30 points | 9 comments)
